items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Infosys, ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank, HDFC Life, NIIT, ABB India, Tata Elxsi, Just Dial, TCS in focus on 21 April
items.description: Stocks to Watch, 21 Apr: Stocks like Infosys, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, HDFC Life Insurance Company, Yes Bank, Jio Financial Services, Tata Elxsi, Just Dial, IndusInd Bank, Tata Consultancy Services, ABB India, and NIIT will be in focus on April 21.

items.title: Data Story | How Wipro fell behind Infosys, TCS in Europe
items.description: Recovery in Europe will be key to Wipro’s revival

items.title: Nomura sees Nifty at 24,970 by March 2026, backs domestic themes amid tariff headwinds
items.description: Nomura said Indian equity markets have shown resilience in the face of global disruptions, and the market is now anticipating the possibility of trade agreements between the US and several countries in the near future, including India and Vietnam.

items.title: Bull run on D-Street: Sensex zooms 1,000 points, Nifty above 24,150; bank stocks lead the rally
items.description: The rally was primarily led by significant buying interest in key sectors like Technology, Banking, Financial Services, and Auto.

items.title: Buy Kansai Nerolac Paints; target of Rs 335: Asit C Mehta
items.description: Asit C Mehta is bullish on Kansai Nerolac Paints has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 335 in its research report dated April 21 2025.

items.title: Buy HDFC Bank; target of Rs 2173: LKP Research
items.description: LKP Research is bullish on HDFC Bank has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 2173 in its research report dated April 21, 2025.

items.title: Yes Bank shares rise 5% as lender posts 63% rise in Q4 net profit on lower provisions
items.description: Yes Bank's provisions and contingencies, or funds kept aside for potential bad loans, fell 32.5% on-year to Rs 318 crore

items.title: HDFC Bank at an inflection point after consolidation in FY25
items.description: The private bank is well placed to benefit from improved liquidity and the interest rate-cut cycle

items.title: ICICI Bank — Will the re-rating continue?
items.description: The bank puts up a strong show in FY25 amid sectoral concerns

items.title: Tata Elxsi Q4 misses street estimates; Morgan Stanley slashes target price
items.description: Tata Elxsi’s March quarter earnings fell short of even muted expectations, prompting Morgan Stanley to slash its target price to ₹4,660 and maintain an ‘Underweight’ rating.

items.title: Live: Can Nifty Reclaim 24,000 Buoyed By Solid Bank Earnings? Infosys Disappoints| Opening Bell
items.description: Indian markets recorded their biggest weekly gain in more than 2 years with the Nifty aiming to reclaim the 24,000 mark. However, the GIFT Nifty is indicating a muted start and global cues are largely negative. ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank will be in focus after strong earnings. All eyes will be on the Nifty Bank index which is very close to its all-time high. Street will also digest Infosys Q4 earnings. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Rajesh Palviya, Senior Vice President Research (Head Technical & Derivatives) at Axis Securities and Siddarth Bhamre, Institutional Research Head - Asit C Mehta Investment Interrmediates.

items.title: Hyundai Motor India shares rise after six-month lock-in expires
items.description: Some analysts see potential for a 21 percent upside in Hyundai Motor India shares, backed by a consensus ‘Buy’ ratings.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on April 21
items.description: On April 21, Nifty closed at 24,125 while Sensex rose 855 points.

items.title: Wall Street futures dip as trade tensions keep investors on edge; Tesla, Alphabet to report earnings this week
items.description: The latest moves follow a choppy stretch on Wall Street, with all three major indices suffering their third weekly decline in the last month.

items.title: Cantabil Retail | Positive SSSG Backed by Retail Expansion | Stock Of the Day
items.description: Focusing on affordability and style, CRIL is rapidly expanding into untapped markets while strengthening its mid-premium offerings. With strategic investments in CAPEX, retail growth, and inventory management, the company aims to achieve FY26 targets of 18-20% top-line growth and robust EBITDA margins.

items.title: Live: Nifty Reclaims 24,100 Led By Banks & IT| Nifty Bank Zooms Past 55,000| Closing Bell
items.description: Nifty reclaimed the 24,100 mark and Nifty Bank hit a fresh record high of 55,461. The broader markets outperformed with the Midcap index surging over 2%. Banking majors HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank touched new highs following their Q4 results, while the Nifty IT index also saw strong gains, led by Tech Mahindra which posted its best performance in nearly a year. All sectors ended in the green, barring FMCG. Catch Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they break down the market action and share the stocks on their radar.

items.title: Eternal moves to cap FPI shareholding to 49.5%, brokerages bullish on margin expansion
items.description: Eternal has proposed capping foreign ownership to gain IOCC status, enabling Blinkit to shift to an inventory-led model and unlock higher margins.

items.title: Markets gain for 5th day: Sensex, Nifty surge 1% as IT, bank stocks rally; small, midcap indices outperform
items.description: Nifty FMCG bucked the broader market trend, slipping nearly a percent as ITC, HUL, and Varun Beverages dragged the index lower.

items.title: Just Dial shares zoom 13% as company's net profit jumps 61% to Rs 584 crore
items.description: Just Dial declared its quarterly results on Friday after the markets hours and as the markets resumed on Monday, the shares of the company skyrocketed.

items.title: FIIs net buyers worth Rs 1,970 crore, DIIs add Rs 246 crore on April 21
items.description: For the year so far, FIIs have been net sellers of shares worth Rs 1.58 lakh crore, while DIIs have net bought Rs 1.99 lakh crore worth of shares.

items.title: Wall Street tumbles for 4th session as trade tensions deepen, Fed uncertainty looms
items.description: Big tech names took a hit across the board. Tesla sank 5 percent, with chipmakers Nvidia and AMD down 4 percent and 2 percent, respectively. Meta Platforms and Amazon also retreated, each losing around 2 percent.

items.title: US stocks extend fall as Trump intensifies Fed attack, trade tensions weigh on sentiment
items.description: Tech heavyweights led the decline. Tesla slumped 7 percent, Nvidia fell 5 percent, and Amazon lost 4 percent. AMD and Meta dropped 3 percent each, while industrial bellwether Caterpillar also shed 3 percent.
